Virtual Hugger in an unkind world.
All views my own.
RT not an endorsement.

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@DavidJCrook @sunneofyork @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Yes there is a footpath along part of the North bank of the River there but has not been easy to walk for some time (lack of field margins)

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm And hopefully planning some emergency strategies for residents and properties downstream (see video). A disaster waiting to happen if flooding occurs again https://t.co/pgp3MMIfek
@LaxBowel @RobGMacfarlane @mildthing99 @EnvAgency I'm told it is upstream from the bridge at Kingsland.
Five years since #StormDesmond hit #Cumbria, new flood defences are offering better protection to at least 2,000 properties according to the @EnvAgencyNW. https://t.co/RN7hvKsjQV

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

tweets.text:
In 2015 Storm Desmond hit Cumbria flooding many areas including the town of #Egremont. 
 
5 years on and #TeamEA are investing 12 million on a flood scheme for the town with works ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding. 
 
For more info - https://t.co/UibqT7Itw6 https://t.co/kDcqp2sM3E
Why, oh why, did it take the Environment Agency SO LONG to act? The public deserve an explanation. @EnvAgency https://t.co/8wSLRzgFx5

@domgreves @DaveThroupEA @MattEAShardlow @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They'll have acted on it as soon as it was known about/reported and the EA enforce on these sorts of situations, not the police.

@MikeDWinter @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency This criminal damage could provide an opportunity for some imaginative restoration involving introducing a pair of beavers to build dams, introduce meandering and slower water flow and attract wildlife much more efficiently and rapidly than man-made interventions
@kathtanner1 @RachB_ @EnvAgencyNW I was speaking to Luke @WestCumbriaRT about getting you guys back out next spring/summer to see it for yourselves üëçüèªüëçüèª

Thankyou to @NorthumbrianH2O and their team for reacting and identifying the company responsible for a discharge into Horton Burn in Cramlington. 48hrs,1500 businesses and 16 miles of feed in drains to investigate and they found them!  @benjaminoc @EnvAgency https://t.co/b9zrLrHLgd

@EnvAgency @ChrisUn77749348 @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Blow me down with a feather.Would say better late than never, but that would be wrong.Shame all the statutory environmental bodies in the UK seem to spend a good deal of time avoiding doing anything about damage and pollution caused by farmers, in case it upsets them.

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency In defence of the local farmer, but parts of the River Lugg in Herefordshire have been flooded almost continuously.
#r4today https://t.co/KQBVdXPNXC

üì¢Brilliant news to share from #StaffsSUNRISE today! @PaulNGaskell from @WildTroutTrust visited our new river channels at #VictoriaGround & @StaffsUni & found several brown trout 'nests' (redds) - meaning they're using them for spawning already!   
@EnvAgencyMids @SoTCityCouncil https://t.co/CIiefX7mqC

Heavy. 
Is this the first piece of enforcement ever so everyone‚Äôs on training? üòÇ

Seriously though, good work @EnvAgency the trashing has to stop now. üôè https://t.co/n3vyJtNvU9
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

News: #Anlaby and #EastElla #Flood Alleviation Scheme wins prestigious national accolade https://t.co/LDvFKPUX3K

#FloodAlleviation #News @Hullccnews  @EnvAgency  #RICSAwards https://t.co/Yjb6yM4RCS

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil More of this please.  Far too much of this is just not pursued.  There must be clear consequences for this desecration of what‚Äôs left of the natural environment.  It is precious and must be fought for.

Please support @wwf @theriverstrust @NatGeo @DefraGovUK @DefraWater @AnglianWater @visitnorfolk @NorfolkAONB @NFUtweets @nationaltrust @Buzz_dont_tweet @WWTworldwide 
@WaterUK @_BTO @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @NENorfolkSufflk @GreenAllianceUK @PondRiverStream @uniofeastanglia https://t.co/pb292ycnLy

tweets.text: We're watching @EnvAgency https://t.co/vne2OG6gjf
This is more like it @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA Well done EA people - let's see what happens of course but you are through the door. https://t.co/Ef5clXXF2V

Sites in #Crawley got a surprise early knock on the door as we we're out with @BTPSussex  and @crawleybc and @WeAreOpenreach checking sites and looking for metal theft.

As well as seizing a vehicle, we'll do further investigations and consider appropriate enforcement action. https://t.co/YQjwx47fj5
@DaveThroupEA @ChrisBaingerEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @The_WMA The River Lugg Internal Drainage Board ?

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and we need more engineers. 

Join us, @EnvAgency and @learnliveuk on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register here: https://t.co/UX0iukfGVl https://t.co/vpzVM1zxJy
@HayekTom @EnvAgencyNW @NTWestLakes Thanks! And no we didn‚Äôt. üòä

Watch 10am >> https://t.co/HZIkH5t0F3 

> as we question @DefraGovUK @HMTreasury @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland
